verses.text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat; and wept when we remembered Sion.
We hung our \f + \fr 136:2 \fl Gr. \ft organs, \fl or, \ft instruments. \f* harps on the willows in the midst of it.
For there they that had taken us captive asked of us the words of a song; and they that had carried us away \add asked\add* a hymn, \add saying\add*, Sing us \add one\add* of the songs of Sion.
How should we sing the Lord's song \f + \fr 136:4 \fl Gr. \ft on \f* in a strange land?
If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget \add its skill\add*.
May my tongue cleave to my throat, if I do not remember you; if I do not prefer Jerusalem as the chief of my joy.
Remember, O Lord, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase \add it\add*, \f + \fr 136:7 \fl Gr. \ft empty, empty. \f* rase \add it\add*, even to its foundations.
Wretched daughter of Babylon! blessed \add shall he be\add* who shall reward you as you have rewarded us.
Blessed \add shall he be\add* who shall seize and dash your infants against the rock.
